intent_atoms.description: Determine whether ISOInspector's notarized build process requires Apple Events automation and document any entitlement or tooling adjustments needed to keep distribution workflows compliant.
Document whether notarization flows rely on Apple Events automation (e.g., driving Finder/archive steps) or can remain purely notarytool-based.
Update entitlements and documentation if Apple Events access is required, or confirm current entitlements are sufficient.
Outline any CI or manual steps needed so future packaging work (release notes, theming, TestFlight/DMG distribution) can proceed without blocking dependencies.
Only add Apple Events entitlements if necessary and ensure documentation captures rationale for security review.
Coordinate changes with sandboxing requirements; only add Apple Events entitlements if necessary and ensure documentation captures rationale for security review.

functional_units.name: Notarization Process Evaluation
functional_units.description: Assess if notarized build workflow requires Apple Events automation or can use only notarytool

functional_units.name: Entitlement Update Procedure
functional_units.description: Add or confirm Apple Events entitlements in the app’s macOS entitlement file based on evaluation

functional_units.name: Documentation of Decision and Rationale
functional_units.description: Record findings, decisions, and security rationale for future reference

functional_units.name: CI/Manual Steps Outline
functional_units.description: Define continuous integration or manual steps needed to avoid blocking dependencies in packaging
